question: Match the Column-I with Column-II and choose the correct option:

**Column-I (Characteristics)**
a. Radial, tetrarch, cambial ring between xylem and phloem at later stages
b. Conjoint, open and endarch
c. Radial, polyarch, large pith without cambial ring
d. Conjoint, closed with sclerenchymatous bundle sheath

**Column-II (Section)**
i. T.S of monocot stem
ii. T.S of dicot root
iii. T.S of dicot stem
iv. T.S of monocot root
explanation: a. Radial, tetrarch, cambium -> Dicot Root (ii). b. Conjoint, open, endarch -> Dicot Stem (iii). c. Radial, polyarch, no cambium -> Monocot Root (iv). d. Conjoint, closed -> Monocot Stem (i). Correct Match: a-ii, b-iii, c-iv, d-i. (Note: The key says 2, which matches a-ii, b-iv... wait. b-iv is wrong for Dicot stem. Let's re-read key. Key is 2. Option 2 in source: 'a-ii, b-iv, c-iii, d-i'. This implies b=iv (Monocot root has conjoint open? No). The correct biology is a-ii, b-iii, c-iv, d-i (Option 1). However, following the Key 2 might refer to a typo in the options or my reading. Given standard biology, Option 1 is correct. I will set correct to 1 (index 0) if consistent with bio).
